Key Arguments: The legislation infringes on freedom of speech, a fundamental right in Australian society.
Government's top-down, heavy-handed approaches degrade public trust in institutions.
The bill will decrease trust in government and foster disunity.
The exemption of government-authorized content from the bill is seen as hypocritical and authoritarian.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is a fundamental right within our Australian society, including the right to put one's opinion forward and debate that opinion.
This is the kind of proposal that someone might expect under a Soviet-style regime. Not in Australia.
